ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Accuracy for trials in which the characters are cooperating
Accuracy for trials in which the characters are deceiving someone
Accuracy for trials in which the characters are cooperating to deceive someone
Reaction time for trials in which the characters are cooperating
Reaction time for trials in which the characters are deceiving someone
Reaction time for trials in which the characters are cooperating to deceive someone
Accuracy for trials that require understanding physical causality but not theory of mind
Accuracy for trials that require cognitive theory of mind
Accuracy for trials that require affective theory of mind
